text: This is the record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah the father of Perez and Zerah (by Tamar), Perez the father of Hezron, Hezron the father of Ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram the father of Amminadab, Amminadab the father of Nahshon, Nahshon the father of Salmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salmon the father of Boaz (by Rahab), Boaz the father of Obed (by Ruth), Obed the father of Jesse,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Jesse the father of David the king.
David was the father of Solomon (by the wife of Uriah),
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asa,
speaker: Narrator

text: Asa the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, Joram the father of Uzziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzziah the father of Jotham, Jotham the father of Ahaz, Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah the father of Manasseh, Manasseh the father of Amon, Amon the father of Josiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Josiah the father of Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the deportation to Babylon, Jeconiah became the father of Shealtiel, Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerubbabel the father of Abiud, Abiud the father of Eliakim, Eliakim the father of Azor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azor the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Achim, Achim the father of Eliud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliud the father of Eleazar, Eleazar the father of Matthan, Matthan the father of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, by whom Jesus was born, who is called Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon, fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to Christ, fourteen generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way. While his mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Joseph, her husband to be, was a righteous man, and because he did not want to disgrace her, he intended to divorce her privately.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had contemplated this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, because the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will give birth to a son and you will name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This all happened so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look! The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will name him Emmanuel,” which means “God with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joseph awoke from sleep he did what the angel of the Lord told him. He took his wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: but did not have marital relations with her until she gave birth to a son, whom he named Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, in the time of King Herod, wise men from the East came to Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Where is the one who is born king of the Jews? For we saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Herod heard this he was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After assembling all the chief priests and experts in the law, he asked them where the Christ was to be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: “In Bethlehem of Judea,” they said, “for it is written this way by the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,
are in no way least among the rulers of Judah,
for out of you will come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod privately summoned the wise men and determined from them when the star had appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and look carefully for the child. When you find him, inform me so that I can go and worship him as well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After listening to the king they left, and once again the star they saw when it rose led them until it stopped above the place where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the star they shouted joyfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they came into the house and saw the child with Mary his mother, they bowed down and worshiped him. They opened their treasure boxes and gave him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
speaker: Narrator

text: After being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back by another route to their own country.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Get up, take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to look for the child to kill him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he got up, took the child and his mother during the night, and went to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stayed there until Herod died. In this way what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet was fulfilled: “I called my Son out of Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, he became enraged. He sent men to kill all the children in Bethlehem and throughout the surrounding region from the age of two and under, according to the time he had learned from the wise men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
weeping and loud wailing,
Rachel weeping for her children,
and she did not want to be comforted, because they were gone.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Herod had died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the child’s life are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he got up and took the child and his mother and returned to the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. After being warned in a dream, he went to the regions of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to a town called Nazareth and lived there. Then what had been spoken by the prophets was fulfilled, that Jesus would be called a Nazarene.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days John the Baptist came into the wilderness of Judea proclaiming,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he is the one about whom the prophet Isaiah had spoken:
“The voice of one shouting in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now John wore clothing made from camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and his diet consisted of locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then people from Jerusalem, as well as all Judea and all the region around the Jordan, were going out to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he was baptizing them in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore produce fruit that proves your repentance,
speaker: Narrator

text: and don’t think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that God can raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
speaker: Narrator

text: Even now the ax is laid at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I baptize you with water, for repentance, but the one coming after me is more powerful than I am—I am not worthy to carry his sandals! He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clean out his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the storehouse, but the chaff he will burn up with inextinguishable fire!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John to be baptized by him in the Jordan River.
speaker: Narrator

text: But John tried to prevent him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and yet you come to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus replied to him, “Let it happen now, for it is right for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then John yielded to him.
speaker: Jesus

text: After Jesus was baptized, just as he was coming up out of the water, the heavens opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming to rest on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a voice from heaven said, “This is my one dear Son; in him I take great delight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he fasted forty days and forty nights he was famished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered, “It is written, ‘Man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil took him to the holy city, had him stand on the highest point of the temple,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you’ and ‘with their hands they will lift you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Once again it is written: ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their grandeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, “I will give you all these things if you throw yourself to the ground and worship me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan! For it is written: ‘You are to worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil left him, and angels came and began ministering to his needs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been imprisoned, he went into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: While in Galilee, he moved from Nazareth to make his home in Capernaum by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
the way by the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the people who sit in darkness have seen a great light,
and on those who sit in the region and shadow of death a light has dawned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time Jesus began to preach this message: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near!”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was walking by the Sea of Galilee he saw two brothers, Simon (called Peter) and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Follow me, and I will turn you into fishers of people!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They left their nets immediately and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Going on from there he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and his brother John, in a boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. Then he called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They immediately left the boat and their father and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went throughout all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So a report about him spread throughout Syria. People brought to him all who suffered with various illnesses and afflictions, those who had seizures, paralytics, and those possessed by demons, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And large crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan River.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw the crowds, he went up the mountain. After he sat down his disciples came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to teach them by saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be satisfied.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called the children of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are you when people insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things about you falsely on account of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Rejoice and be glad, because your reward is great in heaven, for they persecuted the prophets before you in the same way.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the earth. But if salt loses its flavor, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything except to be thrown out and trampled on by people!
speaker: Jesus

text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill cannot be hidden.
speaker: Jesus

text: People do not light a lamp and put it under a basket but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, let your light shine before people, so that they can see your good deeds and give honor to your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets. I have not come to abolish these things but to fulfill them.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you the truth, until heaven and earth pass away not the smallest letter or stroke of a letter will pass from the law until everything takes place.
speaker: Jesus

text: So anyone who breaks one of the least of these commands and teaches others to do so will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever obeys them and teaches others to do so will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: For I tell you, unless your righteousness goes beyond that of the experts in the law and the Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven!
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said to an older generation, ‘Do not murder,’ and ‘whoever murders will be subjected to judgment.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that anyone who is angry with a brother will be subjected to judgment. And whoever insults a brother will be brought before the council, and whoever says ‘Fool’ will be sent to fiery hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, if you bring your gift to the altar and there you remember that your brother has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift there in front of the altar. First go and be reconciled to your brother and then come and present your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: Reach agreement quickly with your accuser while on the way to court, or he may hand you over to the judge, and the judge hand you over to the warden, and you will be thrown into prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you the truth, you will never get out of there until you have paid the last penny!
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to desire her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away! It is better to lose one of your members than to have your whole body thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away! It is better to lose one of your members than to have your whole body go into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “It was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a legal document.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except for immorality, makes her commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Again, you have heard that it was said to an older generation, ‘Do not break an oath, but fulfill your vows to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, do not take oaths at all—not by heaven, because it is the throne of God,
speaker: Jesus

text: not by earth, because it is his footstool, and not by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take an oath by your head, because you are not able to make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: Let your word be ‘Yes, yes’ or ‘No, no.’ More than this is from the evil one.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, do not resist the evildoer. But whoever strikes you on the right cheek, turn the other to him as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if someone wants to sue you and take your tunic, let him have your coat also.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to the one who asks you, and do not reject the one who wants to borrow from you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor’ and ‘hate your enemy.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, love your enemy and pray for those who persecute you,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that you may be like your Father in heaven, since he causes the sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
speaker: Jesus

text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Even the tax collectors do the same, don’t they?
speaker: Jesus

text: And if you only greet your brothers, what more do you do? Even the Gentiles do the same, don’t they?
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Be careful not to display your righteousness merely to be seen by people. Otherwise you have no reward with your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Thus whenever you do charitable giving, do not blow a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in synagogues and on streets so that people will praise them. I tell you the truth, they have their reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you do your giving, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that your gift may be in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to pray while standing in synagogues and on street corners so that people can see them. Truly I say to you, they have their reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: But whenever you pray, go into your inner room, close the door, and pray to your Father in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: When you pray, do not babble repetitiously like the Gentiles, because they think that by their many words they will be heard.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
speaker: Jesus

text:
So pray this way:
Our Father in heaven, may your name be honored,
speaker: Jesus

text:
may your kingdom come,
may your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give us today our daily bread,
speaker: Jesus

text: and forgive us our debts, as we ourselves have forgiven our debtors.
speaker: Jesus

text: And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For if you forgive others their sins, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if you do not forgive others, your Father will not forgive you your sins.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you fast, do not look sullen like the hypocrites, for they make their faces unattractive so that people will see them fasting. I tell you the truth, they have their reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: When you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that it will not be obvious to others when you are fasting, but only to your Father who is in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not accumulate for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and devouring insect destroy and where thieves break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: But accumulate for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and devouring insect do not destroy, and thieves do not break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. If then your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if your eye is diseased, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Isn’t there more to life than food and more to the body than clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds in the sky: They do not sow, or reap, or gather into barns, yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you more valuable than they are?
speaker: Jesus

text: And which of you by worrying can add even one hour to his life?
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you worry about clothing? Think about how the flowers of the field grow; they do not work or spin.
speaker: Jesus

text: Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these!
speaker: Jesus

text: And if this is how God clothes the wild grass, which is here today and tomorrow is tossed into the fire to heat the oven, won’t he clothe you even more, you people of little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, don’t worry saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: For the unconverted pursue these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them.
speaker: Jesus

text: But above all pursue his kingdom and righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Today has enough trouble of its own.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not judge so that you will not be judged.
speaker: Jesus

text: For by the standard you judge you will be judged, and the measure you use will be the measure you receive.
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye, but fail to see the beam of wood in your own?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while there is a beam in your own?
speaker: Jesus

text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not give what is holy to dogs or throw your pearls before pigs; otherwise they will trample them under their feet and turn around and tear you to pieces.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: Is there anyone among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a snake?
speaker: Jesus

text: If you then, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
speaker: Jesus

text: In everything, treat others as you would want them to treat you, for this fulfills the law and the prophets.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Enter through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the way is spacious that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter through it.
speaker: Jesus

text: How narrow is the gate and difficult the way that leads to life, and there are few who find it!
speaker: Jesus

text: “Watch out for false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are voracious wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will recognize them by their fruit. Grapes are not gathered from thorns or figs from thistles, are they?
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, every good tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears bad fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree is not able to bear bad fruit, nor a bad tree to bear good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, you will recognize them by their fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the kingdom of heaven—only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: On that day, many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many powerful deeds in your name?’
speaker: Jesus

text: Then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you. Go away from me, you lawbreakers!’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone who hears these words of mine and does them is like a wise man who built his house on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, the flood came, and the winds beat against that house, but it did not collapse because its foundation had been laid on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: Everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, the flood came, and the winds beat against that house, and it collapsed—it was utterly destroyed!”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed by his teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he taught them like one who had authority, not like their experts in the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a leper approached and bowed low before him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out his hand and touched him saying, “I am willing. Be clean!” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you do not speak to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and bring the offering that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When he entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him asking for help:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, in terrible anguish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof! Instead, just say the word and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I too am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this he was amazed and said to those who followed him, “I tell you the truth, I have not found such faith in anyone in Israel!
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you, many will come from the east and west to share the banquet with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
speaker: Jesus

text: but the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; just as you believed, it will be done for you.” And the servant was healed at that hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when Jesus entered Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying down, sick with a fever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she got up and began to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, many demon-possessed people were brought to him. He drove out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In this way what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah was fulfilled:
“He took our weaknesses and carried our diseases.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus saw a large crowd around him, he gave orders to go to the other side of the lake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then an expert in the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens, and the birds in the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Another of the disciples said to him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: As he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a great storm developed on the sea so that the waves began to swamp the boat. But he was asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came and woke him up saying, “Lord, save us! We are about to die!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “Why are you cowardly, you people of little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and it was dead calm.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the men were amazed and said, “What sort of person is this? Even the winds and the sea obey him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were extremely violent, so that no one was able to pass by that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried out, “Son of God, leave us alone! Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
speaker: Narrator

text: A large herd of pigs was feeding some distance from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the demons begged him, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Go!” So they came out and went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep slope into the lake and drowned in the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The herdsmen ran off, went into the town, and told everything that had happened to the demon-possessed men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the entire town came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: After getting into a boat he crossed to the other side and came to his own town.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then some people brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Have courage, son! Your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then some of the experts in the law said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus perceived their thoughts he said, “Why do you respond with evil in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—then he said to the paralytic—“Stand up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: So he stood up and went home.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowd saw this, they were afraid and honored God who had given such authority to men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him. So he got up and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: As Jesus was having a meal in Matthew’s house, many tax collectors and sinners came and ate with Jesus and his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw this they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this he said, “Those who are healthy don’t need a physician, but those who are sick do.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go and learn what this saying means: ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then John’s disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot mourn while the bridegroom is with them, can they? But the days are coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, because the patch will pull away from the garment and the tear will be worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the skins burst and the wine is spilled out and the skins are destroyed. Instead they put new wine into new wineskins and both are preserved.”
speaker: Jesus

text: As he was saying these things, a leader came, bowed low before him, and said, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a woman who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she kept saying to herself, “If only I touch his cloak, I will be healed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus turned and saw her he said, “Have courage, daughter! Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was healed from that hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus entered the leader’s house and saw the flute players and the disorderly crowd,
speaker: Narrator

text: he said, “Go away, for the girl is not dead but asleep!” And they began making fun of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the crowd had been forced outside, he went in and gently took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the news of this spread throughout that region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men began to follow him, shouting, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he went into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he touched their eyes saying, “Let it be done for you according to your faith.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus sternly warned them, “See that no one knows about this!”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that entire region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were going away, a man who was demon-possessed and unable to speak was brought to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the demon was cast out, the man who had been mute began to speak. The crowds were amazed and said, “Never has anything like this been seen in Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees said, “By the ruler of demons he casts out demons!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went throughout all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them because they were bewildered and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest-ready fields.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus called his twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits so they could cast them out and heal every kind of disease and sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon (called Peter), and Andrew his brother; James son of Zebedee and John his brother;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus sent out these twelve, instructing them as follows: “Do not go on a road that leads to Gentile regions and do not enter any Samaritan town.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, preach this message: ‘The kingdom of heaven is near!’
speaker: Jesus

text: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, cast out demons. Freely you received, freely give.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take gold, silver, or copper in your belts,
speaker: Jesus

text: no bag for the journey, or an extra tunic, or sandals or staff, for the worker deserves his provisions.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whenever you enter a town or village, find out who is worthy there and stay with them until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you enter the house, greet those within it.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if the house is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if anyone will not welcome you or listen to your message, shake the dust off your feet as you leave that house or that town.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you the truth, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town!
speaker: Jesus

text: “I am sending you out like sheep surrounded by wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: Beware of people, because they will hand you over to councils and flog you in their synagogues.
speaker: Jesus

text: And you will be brought before governors and kings because of me, as a witness to them and to the Gentiles.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whenever they hand you over for trial, do not worry about how to speak or what to say, for what you should say will be given to you at that time.
speaker: Jesus

text: For it is not you speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
speaker: Jesus

text: And you will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved!
speaker: Jesus

text: Whenever they persecute you in one town, flee to another! I tell you the truth, you will not finish going through all the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A disciple is not greater than his teacher, nor a slave greater than his master.
speaker: Jesus

text: It is enough for the disciple to become like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they have called the head of the house ‘Beelzebul,’ how much worse will they call the members of his household!
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not be afraid of them, for nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known.
speaker: Jesus

text: What I say to you in the dark, tell in the light, and what is whispered in your ear, proclaim from the housetops.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be afraid of those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Instead, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: Aren’t two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father’s will.
speaker: Jesus

text: Even all the hairs on your head are numbered.
speaker: Jesus

text: So do not be afraid; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever, then, acknowledges me before people, I will acknowledge before my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whoever denies me before people, I will deny him also before my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I have not come to bring peace but a sword!
speaker: Jesus

text: For I have come to set a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law,
speaker: Jesus

text: and a man’s enemies will be the members of his household.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever finds his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life because of me will find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives the one who sent me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. Whoever receives a righteous person in the name of a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: And whoever gives only a cup of cold water to one of these little ones in the name of a disciple, I tell you the truth, he will never lose his reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when John heard in prison about the deeds Christ had done, he sent his disciples to ask a question:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Go tell John what you hear and see:
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have good news proclaimed to them
speaker: Narrator

text: —and blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were going away, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Look, those who wear soft clothing are in the palaces of kings!
speaker: Narrator

text: What did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet!
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the one about whom it is written:
‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
who will prepare your way before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “I tell you the truth, among those born of women, no one has arisen greater than John the Baptist. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he is!
speaker: Narrator

text: From the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and forceful people lay hold of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah, who is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who has ears had better listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “To what should I compare this generation? They are like children sitting in the marketplaces who call out to one another,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘We played the flute for you, yet you did not dance;
we wailed in mourning, yet you did not weep.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look at him, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus began to criticize openly the cities in which he had done many of his miracles, because they did not repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! If the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you!
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to Hades! For if the miracles done among you had been done in Sodom, it would have continued to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom on the day of judgment than for you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and have revealed them to little children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, Father, for this was your gracious will.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son decides to reveal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take my yoke on you and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my yoke is easy to bear, and my load is not hard to carry.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on a Sabbath. His disciples were hungry, and they began to pick heads of wheat and eat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees saw this they said to him, “Look, your disciples are doing what is against the law to do on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry—
speaker: Narrator

text: how he entered the house of God and ate the sacred bread, which was against the law for him or his companions to eat, but only for the priests?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or have you not read in the law that the priests in the temple desecrate the Sabbath and yet are not guilty?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that something greater than the temple is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you had known what this means: ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus left that place and entered their synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man was there who had a withered hand. And they asked Jesus, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?” so that they could accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Would not any one of you, if he had one sheep that fell into a pit on the Sabbath, take hold of it and lift it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: How much more valuable is a person than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out and it was restored, as healthy as the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees went out and plotted against him, as to how they could assassinate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus learned of this, he went away from there. Great crowds followed him, and he healed them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he sternly warned them not to make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: This fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Here is my servant whom I have chosen,
the one I love, in whom I take great delight.
I will put my Spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not quarrel or cry out,
nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not break a bruised reed or extinguish a smoldering wick,
until he brings justice to victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his name the Gentiles will hope.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute. Jesus healed him so that he could speak and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the crowds were amazed and said, “Could this one be the Son of David?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees heard this they said, “He does not cast out demons except by the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus realized what they were thinking, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and no town or house divided against itself will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? For this reason they will be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has already overtaken you.
speaker: Narrator

text: How else can someone enter a strong man’s house and steal his property, unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can thoroughly plunder the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I tell you, people will be forgiven for every sin and blasphemy, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad, for a tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Offspring of vipers! How are you able to say anything good, since you are evil? For the mouth speaks from what fills the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good person brings good things out of his good treasury, and the evil person brings evil things out of his evil treasury.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that on the day of judgment, people will give an account for every worthless word they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the experts in the law along with some Pharisees answered him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them—and now, something greater than Jonah is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon—and now, something greater than Solomon is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it passes through waterless places looking for rest but does not find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I left.’ When it returns, it finds the house empty, swept clean, and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there, so the last state of that person is worse than the first. It will be that way for this evil generation as well!”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was still speaking to the crowds, his mother and brothers came and stood outside, asking to speak to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone told him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside wanting to speak to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: To the one who had said this, Jesus replied, “Who is my mother and who are my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And pointing toward his disciples he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day after Jesus went out of the house, he sat by the lake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat to sit while the whole crowd stood on the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them many things in parables, saying: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he sowed, some seeds fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell on rocky ground where they did not have much soil. They sprang up quickly because the soil was not deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sun came up, they were scorched, and because they did not have sufficient root, they withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and they grew up and choked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But other seeds fell on good soil and produced grain, some a hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who has ears had better listen!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to him and said, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “You have been given the opportunity to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but they have not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever has will be given more, and will have an abundance. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I speak to them in parables: Although they see they do not see, and although they hear they do not hear nor do they understand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And concerning them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled that says:
‘You will listen carefully yet will never understand,
you will look closely yet will never comprehend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the heart of this people has become dull;
they are hard of hearing,
and they have shut their eyes,
so that they would not see with their eyes
and hear with their ears
and understand with their hearts
and turn, and I would heal them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But your eyes are blessed because they see, and your ears because they hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you the truth, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So listen to the parable of the sower:
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the word about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches what was sown in his heart; this is the seed sown along the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed sown on rocky ground is the person who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he has no root in himself and does not endure; when trouble or persecution comes because of the word, immediately he falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed sown among thorns is the person who hears the word, but worldly cares and the seductiveness of wealth choke the word, so it produces nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for the seed sown on good soil, this is the person who hears the word and understands. He bears fruit, yielding a hundred, sixty, or thirty times what was sown.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He presented them with another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a person who sowed good seed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while everyone was sleeping, an enemy came and sowed darnel among the wheat and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the plants sprouted and produced grain, then the darnel also appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the slaves of the landowner came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Then where did the darnel come from?’
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, ‘An enemy has done this!’ So the slaves replied, ‘Do you want us to go and gather it?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, ‘No, since in gathering the darnel you may uproot the wheat along with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let both grow together until the harvest. At harvest time I will tell the reapers, “First collect the darnel and tie it in bundles to be burned, but then gather the wheat into my barn.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it has grown it is the greatest garden plant and becomes a tree, so that the wild birds come and nest in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all the dough had risen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the crowds; he did not speak to them without a parable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet:
“I will open my mouth in parables,
I will announce what has been hidden from the foundation of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he left the crowds and went into the house. And his disciples came to him saying, “Explain to us the parable of the darnel in the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The field is the world and the good seed are the people of the kingdom. The poisonous weeds are the people of the evil one,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the poisonous weeds are collected and burned with fire, so it will be at the end of the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will gather from his kingdom everything that causes sin as well as all lawbreakers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. The one who has ears had better listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure, hidden in a field, that a person found and hid. Then because of joy he went and sold all that he had and bought that field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found a pearl of great value, he went out and sold everything he had and bought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was cast into the sea that caught all kinds of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was full, they pulled it ashore, sat down, and put the good fish into containers and threw the bad away.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will be this way at the end of the age. Angels will come and separate the evil from the righteous
speaker: Narrator

text: and throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Have you understood all these things?” They replied, “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Therefore every expert in the law who has been trained for the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house who brings out of his treasure what is new and old.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus finished these parables, he moved on from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came to his hometown and began to teach the people in their synagogue. They were astonished and said, “Where did this man get such wisdom and miraculous powers?
speaker: Narrator

text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother named Mary? And aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
speaker: Narrator

text: And aren’t all his sisters here with us? So where did he get all this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard reports about Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead! And because of this, miraculous powers are at work in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: because John had repeatedly told him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Although Herod wanted to kill John, he feared the crowd because they accepted John as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on Herod’s birthday, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod,
speaker: Narrator

text: so much that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instructed by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Although it grieved the king, because of his oath and the dinner guests he commanded it to be given.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sent and had John beheaded in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then John’s disciples came and took the body and buried it and went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard this he went away from there privately in a boat to an isolated place. But when the crowd heard about it, they followed him on foot from the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he got out he saw the large crowd, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening arrived, his disciples came to him saying, “This is an isolated place and the hour is already late. Send the crowds away so that they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied, “They don’t need to go. You give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring them here to me,” he replied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he instructed the crowds to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and two fish, and looking up to heaven he gave thanks and broke the loaves. He gave them to the disciples, who in turn gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, twelve baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not counting women and children, there were about 5,000 men who ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he dispersed the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after he sent the crowds away, he went up the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile the boat, already far from land, was taking a beating from the waves because the wind was against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the night was ending, Jesus came to them walking on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw him walking on the water they were terrified and said, “It’s a ghost!” and cried out with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them: “Have courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Lord, if it is you, order me to come to you on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he said, “Come.” Peter got out of the boat, walked on the water, and came toward Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw the strong wind he became afraid. And starting to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him, saying to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went up into the boat, the wind ceased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those who were in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people there recognized him, they sent word into all the surrounding area, and they brought all their sick to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They begged him if they could only touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharisees and experts in the law came from Jerusalem to Jesus and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “And why do you disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?
speaker: Narrator

text: For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother’ and ‘Whoever insults his father or mother must be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say, ‘If someone tells his father or mother, “Whatever help you would have received from me is given to God,”
speaker: Narrator

text: he does not need to honor his father.’ You have nullified the word of God on account of your tradition.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied correctly about you when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘This people honors me with their lips,
but their heart is far from me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and they worship me in vain,
teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called the crowd to him and said, “Listen and understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: What defiles a person is not what goes into the mouth; it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles a person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to him and said, “Do you know that when the Pharisees heard this saying they were offended?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he replied, “Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave them! They are blind guides. If someone who is blind leads another who is blind, both will fall into a pit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to him, “Explain this parable to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Even after all this, are you still so foolish?
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you understand that whatever goes into the mouth enters the stomach and then passes out into the sewer?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and these things defile a person.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of the heart come evil ideas, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things that defile a person; it is not eating with unwashed hands that defiles a person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After going out from there, Jesus went to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Canaanite woman from that area came and cried out, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is horribly demon-possessed!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not answer her a word. Then his disciples came and begged him, “Send her away, because she keeps on crying out after us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she came and bowed down before him and said, “Lord, help me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “It is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs,” he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yes, Lord,” she replied, “but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, your faith is great! Let what you want be done for you.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he left there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up a mountain, where he sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then large crowds came to him bringing with them the lame, blind, crippled, mute, and many others. They laid them at his feet, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, the crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they praised the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have already been here with me three days and they have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry since they may faint on the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Where can we get enough bread in this desolate place to satisfy so great a crowd?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” They replied, “Seven—and a few small fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After instructing the crowd to sit down on the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: he took the seven loaves and the fish, and after giving thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples, who then gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not counting children and women, there were 4,000 men who ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: After sending away the crowd, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “When evening comes you say, ‘It will be fair weather, because the sky is red,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the morning, ‘It will be stormy today, because the sky is red and darkening.’ You know how to judge correctly the appearance of the sky, but you cannot evaluate the signs of the times.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” Then he left them and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples went to the other side, they forgot to take bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Watch out,” Jesus said to them, “beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “It is because we brought no bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus learned of this, he said, “You who have such little faith! Why are you arguing among yourselves about having no bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you still not understand? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the 5,000, and how many baskets you took up?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the seven loaves for the 4,000 and how many baskets you took up?
speaker: Narrator

text: How could you not understand that I was not speaking to you about bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that he had not told them to be on guard against the yeast in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came to the area of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, “You are blessed, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father in heaven!
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overpower it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he instructed his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him: “God forbid, Lord! This must not happen to you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, because you are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but on man’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life because of me will find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what does it benefit a person if he gains the whole world but forfeits his life? Or what can a person give in exchange for his life?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man will come with his angels in the glory of his Father, and then he will reward each person according to what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days later Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John the brother of James, and led them privately up a high mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Elijah also appeared before them, talking with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, I will make three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my one dear Son, in whom I take great delight. Listen to him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they were overwhelmed with fear and threw themselves down with their faces to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus came and touched them. “Get up,” he said. “Do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they looked up, all they saw was Jesus alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Do not tell anyone about the vision until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples asked him, “Why then do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Elijah does indeed come first and will restore all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tell you that Elijah has already come. Yet they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted. In the same way, the Son of Man will suffer at their hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples understood that he was speaking to them about John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the crowd, a man came to him, knelt before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Lord, have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers terribly, for he often falls into the fire and into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought him to your disciples, but they were not able to heal him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You unbelieving and perverse generation! How much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I endure you? Bring him here to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus rebuked the demon and it came out of him, and the boy was healed from that moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them, “It was because of your little faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; nothing will be impossible for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they gathered together in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they became greatly distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Your teacher pays the double drachma tax, doesn’t he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Yes.” When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do earthly kings collect tolls or taxes—from their sons or from foreigners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said, “From foreigners,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
speaker: Narrator

text: But so that we don’t offend them, go to the lake and throw out a hook. Take the first fish that comes up, and when you open its mouth, you will find a four drachma coin. Take that and give it to them for me and you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus saying, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He called a child, had him stand among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “I tell you the truth, unless you turn around and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever then humbles himself like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a huge millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the open sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the world because of stumbling blocks! It is necessary that stumbling blocks come, but woe to the person through whom they come.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into fiery hell.
speaker: Narrator
