text: “See that you do not disdain one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: What do you think? If someone owns a hundred sheep and one of them goes astray, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains and go look for the one that went astray?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he will rejoice more over it than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, your Father in heaven is not willing that one of these little ones be lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your brother sins, go and show him his fault when the two of you are alone. If he listens to you, you have regained your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he does not listen, take one or two others with you, so that at the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter may be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. If he refuses to listen to the church, treat him like a Gentile or a tax collector.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, I tell you the truth, if two of you on earth agree about whatever you ask, my Father in heaven will do it for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For where two or three are assembled in my name, I am there among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter came to him and said, “Lord, how many times must I forgive my brother who sins against me? As many as seven times?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Not seven times, I tell you, but seventy-seven times!
speaker: Narrator

text: “For this reason, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he began settling his accounts, a man who owed 10,000 talents was brought to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he was not able to repay it, the lord ordered him to be sold, along with his wife, children, and whatever he possessed, and repayment to be made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the slave threw himself to the ground before him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay you everything.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The lord had compassion on that slave and released him, and forgave him the debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he went out, that same slave found one of his fellow slaves who owed him 100 silver coins. So he grabbed him by the throat and started to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe me!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his fellow slave threw himself down and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he refused. Instead, he went out and threw him in prison until he repaid the debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were very upset and went and told their lord everything that had taken place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his lord called the first slave and said to him, ‘Evil slave! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Should you not have shown mercy to your fellow slave, just as I showed it to you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And in anger his lord turned him over to the prison guards to torture him until he repaid all he owed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also my heavenly Father will do to you, if each of you does not forgive your brother from your heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus finished these sayings, he left Galilee and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan River.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some Pharisees came to him in order to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful to divorce a wife for any cause?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Have you not read that from the beginning the Creator made them male and female,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and will be united with his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?
speaker: Narrator

text: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Why then did Moses command us to give a certificate of dismissal and to divorce her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because of your hard hearts, but from the beginning it was not this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except for immorality, and marries another commits adultery.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “If this is the case of a husband with a wife, it is better not to marry!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Not everyone can accept this statement, except those to whom it has been given.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are some eunuchs who were that way from birth, and some who were made eunuchs by others, and some who became eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this should accept it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then little children were brought to him for him to lay his hands on them and pray. But the disciples scolded those who brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he placed his hands on them and went on his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now someone came up to him and said, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to gain eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him, “Why do you ask me about what is good? There is only one who is good. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Which ones?” he asked. Jesus replied, “Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,
speaker: Narrator

text: honor your father and mother, and love your neighbor as yourself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The young man said to him, “I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws. What do I still lack?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “If you wish to be perfect, go sell your possessions and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the young man heard this he went away sorrowful, for he was very rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven!
speaker: Narrator

text: Again I say, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter into the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples were greatly astonished when they heard this and said, “Then who can be saved?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus looked at them and replied, “This is impossible for mere humans, but for God all things are possible.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to him, “Look, we have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth: In the age when all things are renewed, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after agreeing with the workers for the standard wage, he sent them into his vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was about nine o’clock in the morning, he went out again and saw others standing around in the marketplace without work.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard too, and I will give you whatever is right.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went. When he went out again about noon and three o’clock that afternoon, he did the same thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And about five o’clock that afternoon he went out and found others standing around, and said to them, ‘Why are you standing here all day without work?’
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go and work in the vineyard too.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages starting with the last hired until the first.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When those hired about five o’clock came, each received a full day’s pay.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when those hired first came, they thought they would receive more. But each one also received the standard wage.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they received it, they began to complain against the landowner,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, ‘These last fellows worked one hour, and you have made them equal to us who bore the hardship and burning heat of the day.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the landowner replied to one of them, ‘Friend, I am not treating you unfairly. Didn’t you agree with me to work for the standard wage?
speaker: Narrator

text: Take what is yours and go. I want to give to this last man the same as I gave to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Am I not permitted to do what I want with what belongs to me? Or are you envious because I am generous?’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the last will be first, and the first last.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve aside privately and said to them on the way,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the experts in the law. They will condemn him to death,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will turn him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged severely and crucified. Yet on the third day, he will be raised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, and kneeling down she asked him for a favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to her, “What do you want?” She replied, “Permit these two sons of mine to sit, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup I am about to drink?” They said to him, “We are able.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them, “You will drink my cup, but to sit at my right and at my left is not mine to give. Rather, it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the other ten heard this, they were angry with the two brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus called them and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in high positions use their authority over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It must not be this way among you! Instead whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave—
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two blind men were sitting by the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd scolded them to get them to be quiet. But they shouted even more loudly, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus stopped, called them, and said, “What do you want me to do for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Lord, let our eyes be opened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: telling them, “Go to the village ahead of you. Right away you will find a donkey tied there, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone says anything to you, you are to say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them at once.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This took place to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Tell the people of Zion,
‘Look, your king is coming to you,
unassuming and seated on a donkey,
and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the donkey and the colt and placed their cloaks on them, and he sat on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowds that went ahead of him and those following kept shouting, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he entered Jerusalem the whole city was thrown into an uproar, saying, “Who is this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowds were saying, “This is the prophet Jesus, from Nazareth in Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple courts, and turned over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are turning it into a den of robbers!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind and lame came to him in the temple courts, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the chief priests and the experts in the law saw the wonderful things he did and heard the children crying out in the temple courts, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they became indignant
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Do you hear what they are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read, ‘Out of the mouths of children and nursing infants you have prepared praise for yourself’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaving them, he went out of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now early in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: After noticing a fig tree by the road he went to it, but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, “Never again will there be fruit from you!” And the fig tree withered at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw it they were amazed, saying, “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only will you do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whatever you ask in prayer, if you believe, you will receive.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after Jesus entered the temple courts, the chief priests and elders of the people came up to him as he was teaching and said, “By what authority are you doing these things, and who gave you this authority?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer me then I will also tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where did John’s baptism come from? From heaven or from people?” They discussed this among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we say, ‘From people,’ we fear the crowd, for they all consider John to be a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then he said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: “What do you think? A man had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work in the vineyard today.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The boy answered, ‘I will not.’ But later he had a change of heart and went.
speaker: Narrator

text: The father went to the other son and said the same thing. This boy answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but did not go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of the two did his father’s will?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, tax collectors and prostitutes will go ahead of you into the kingdom of God!
speaker: Narrator

text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe. Although you saw this, you did not later change your minds and believe him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a pit for its winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went on a journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the harvest time was near, he sent his slaves to the tenants to collect his portion of the crop.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the tenants seized his slaves, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he sent other slaves, more than the first, and they treated them the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the tenants saw the son, they said to themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and get his inheritance!’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they seized him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “He will utterly destroy those evil men! Then he will lease the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his portion at the harvest.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the scriptures:
‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls will be crushed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they realized that he was speaking about them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, because the crowds regarded him as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom of heaven can be compared to a king who gave a wedding banquet for his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent his slaves to summon those who had been invited to the banquet, but they would not come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he sent other slaves, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “Look! The feast I have prepared for you is ready. My oxen and fattened cattle have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were indifferent and went away, one to his farm, another to his business.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest seized his slaves, insolently mistreated them, and killed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king was furious! He sent his soldiers, and they put those murderers to death and set their city on fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to his slaves, ‘The wedding is ready, but the ones who had been invited were not worthy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So go into the main streets and invite everyone you find to the wedding banquet.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And those slaves went out into the streets and gathered all they found, both bad and good, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the king came in to see the wedding guests, he saw a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ But he had nothing to say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king said to his attendants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!’
speaker: Narrator

text: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees went out and planned together to entrap him with his own words.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sent to him their disciples along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful, and teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You do not court anyone’s favor because you show no partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell us then, what do you think? Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus realized their evil intentions and said, “Hypocrites! Why are you testing me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me the coin used for the tax.” So they brought him a denarius.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They replied, “Caesar’s.” He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard this they were stunned, and they left him and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same day Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to him and asked him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and father children for his brother.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children he left his wife to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second did the same, and the third, down to the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Last of all, the woman died.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “You are deceived, because you don’t know the scriptures or the power of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as for the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds heard this, they were amazed at his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they assembled together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them, an expert in religious law, asked him a question to test him:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, which commandment in the law is the greatest?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the first and greatest commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
speaker: Narrator

text: All the law and the prophets depend on these two commandments.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus asked them a question:
speaker: Narrator

text: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said, “The son of David.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “How then does David by the Spirit call him ‘Lord,’ saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘The Lord said to my lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
until I put your enemies under your feet”’?
speaker: Narrator

text: If David then calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: No one was able to answer him a word, and from that day on no one dared to question him any longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The experts in the law and the Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pay attention to what they tell you and do it. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tie up heavy loads, hard to carry, and put them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing even to lift a finger to move them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do all their deeds to be seen by people, for they make their phylacteries wide and their tassels long.
speaker: Narrator

text: They love the place of honor at banquets and the best seats in the synagogues
speaker: Narrator

text: and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces, and to have people call them ‘Rabbi.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher and you are all brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And call no one your ‘father’ on earth, for you have one Father, who is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor are you to be called ‘teacher,’ for you have one teacher, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: The greatest among you will be your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You keep locking people out of the kingdom of heaven! For you neither enter nor permit those trying to enter to go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You cross land and sea to make one convert, and when you get one, you make him twice as much a child of hell as yourselves!
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple is bound by nothing. But whoever swears by the gold of the temple is bound by the oath.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind fools! Which is greater, the gold or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
speaker: Narrator

text: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar is bound by nothing. But if anyone swears by the gift on it he is bound by the oath.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You are blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
speaker: Narrator

text: So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever swears by the temple swears by it and the one who dwells in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and the one who sits on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You give a tenth of mint, dill, and cumin, yet you neglect what is more important in the law—justice, mercy, and faithfulness! You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind guides! You strain out a gnat yet swallow a camel!
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup, so that the outside may become clean too!
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs that look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of the bones of the dead and of everything unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, on the outside you look righteous to people, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have participated with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
speaker: Narrator

text: By saying this you testify against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill up then the measure of your ancestors!
speaker: Narrator

text: You snakes, you offspring of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?
speaker: Narrator

text: “For this reason I am sending you prophets and wise men and experts in the law, some of whom you will kill and crucify, and some you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that on you will come all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you the truth, this generation will be held responsible for all these things!
speaker: Narrator

text: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have longed to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would have none of it!
speaker: Narrator

text: Look, your house is left to you desolate!
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Jesus was going out of the temple courts and walking away, his disciples came to show him the temple buildings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do you see all these things? I tell you the truth, not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately and said, “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Watch out that no one misleads you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will mislead many.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. Make sure that you are not alarmed, for this must happen, but the end is still to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these things are the beginning of birth pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then they will hand you over to be persecuted and will kill you. You will be hated by all the nations because of my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then many will be led into sin, and they will betray one another and hate one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many false prophets will appear and deceive many,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because lawlessness will increase so much, the love of many will grow cold.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the person who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached throughout the whole inhabited earth as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So when you see the abomination of desolation—spoken about by Daniel the prophet—standing in the holy place” (let the reader understand),
speaker: Narrator

text: “then those in Judea must flee to the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one on the roof must not come down to take anything out of his house,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the one in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray that your flight may not be in winter or on a Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For then there will be great suffering unlike anything that has happened from the beginning of the world until now, or ever will happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if those days had not been cut short, no one would be saved. But for the sake of the elect those days will be cut short.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘There he is!’ do not believe him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, I have told you ahead of time.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, if someone says to you, ‘Look, he is in the wilderness,’ do not go out, or ‘Look, he is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just like the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Immediately after the suffering of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man arriving on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet blast, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Learn this parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also you, when you see all these things, know that he is near, right at the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But as for that day and hour no one knows it—not even the angels in heaven—except the Father alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just like the days of Noah were, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in those days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they knew nothing until the flood came and took them all away. It will be the same at the coming of the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there will be two men in the field; one will be taken and one left.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be two women grinding grain with a mill; one will be taken and one left.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore stay alert, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have been alert and would not have let his house be broken into.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Who then is the faithful and wise slave, whom the master has put in charge of his household, to give the other slaves their food at the proper time?
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that slave whom the master finds at work when he comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you the truth, the master will put him in charge of all his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if that evil slave should say to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and he begins to beat his fellow slaves and to eat and drink with drunkards,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not foresee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will cut him in two, and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five of the virgins were foolish, and five were wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the foolish ones took their lamps, they did not take extra olive oil with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wise ones took flasks of olive oil with their lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the bridegroom was delayed a long time, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at midnight there was a shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom is here! Come out to meet him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘No,’ they replied. ‘There won’t be enough for you and for us. Go instead to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But while they had gone to buy it, the bridegroom arrived, and those who were ready went inside with him to the wedding banquet. Then the door was shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, the other virgins came too, saying, ‘Lord, lord! Let us in!’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied, ‘I tell you the truth, I do not know you!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore stay alert, because you do not know the day or the hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For it is like a man going on a journey, who summoned his slaves and entrusted his property to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who had received five talents went off right away and put his money to work and gained five more.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, the one who had two gained two more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who had received one talent went out and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After a long time, the master of those slaves came and settled his accounts with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who had received the five talents came and brought five more, saying, ‘Sir, you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.’
speaker: Narrator

text: His master answered, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful in a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The one with the two talents also came and said, ‘Sir, you entrusted two talents to me. See, I have gained two more.’
speaker: Narrator

text: His master answered, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful with a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the one who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Sir, I knew that you were a hard man, harvesting where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter seed,
speaker: Narrator

text: so I was afraid, and I went and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But his master answered, ‘Evil and lazy slave! So you knew that I harvest where I didn’t sow and gather where I didn’t scatter?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you should have deposited my money with the bankers, and on my return I would have received my money back with interest!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore take the talent from him and give it to the one who has ten.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the one who has will be given more, and he will have more than enough. But the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And throw that worthless slave into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations will be assembled before him, and he will separate people one from another like a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,
speaker: Narrator

text: I was naked and you gave me clothing, I was sick and you took care of me, I was in prison and you visited me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
speaker: Narrator

text: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or naked and clothe you?
speaker: Narrator

text: When did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king will answer them, ‘I tell you the truth, just as you did it for one of the least of these brothers or sisters of mine, you did it for me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you accursed, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the devil and his angels!
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was a stranger and you did not receive me as a guest, naked and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not visit me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they too will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not give you whatever you needed?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he will answer them, ‘I tell you the truth, just as you did not do it for one of the least of these, you did not do it for me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And these will depart into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he told his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people met together in the palace of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas.
speaker: Narrator

text: They planned to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they said, “Not during the feast, so that there won’t be a riot among the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
speaker: Narrator

text: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of expensive perfumed oil, and she poured it on his head as he was at the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw this, they became indignant and said, “Why this waste?
speaker: Narrator

text: It could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus learned of this, he said to them, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a good service for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me!
speaker: Narrator

text: When she poured this oil on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you the truth, wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one of the twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “What will you give me to betray him into your hands?” So they set out thirty silver coins for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on, Judas began looking for an opportunity to betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and said, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near. I will observe the Passover with my disciples at your house.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples did as Jesus had instructed them, and they prepared the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, he took his place at the table with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while they were eating he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They became greatly distressed and each one began to say to him, “Surely not I, Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will go as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if he had never been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” Jesus replied, “You have said it yourself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it, gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat, this is my body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after taking the cup and giving thanks, he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for this is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, from now on I will not drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Jesus said to them, “This night you will all fall away because of me, for it is written:
‘I will strike the shepherd,
and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “If they all fall away because of you, I will never fall away!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, on this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Even if I must die with you, I will never deny you.” And all the disciples said the same thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and became anguished and distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Remain here and stay awake with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Going a little farther, he threw himself down with his face to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if possible, let this cup pass from me! Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came to the disciples and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “So, couldn’t you stay awake with me for one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay awake and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if this cup cannot be taken away unless I drink it, your will must be done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He came again and found them sleeping; they could not keep their eyes open.
speaker: Narrator

text: So leaving them again, he went away and prayed for the third time, saying the same thing once more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is approaching, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get up, let us go. Look! My betrayer is approaching!”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests and elders of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him!”)
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi,” and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Friend, do what you are here to do.” Then they came and took hold of Jesus and arrested him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of those with Jesus grabbed his sword, drew it out, and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back in its place! For all who take hold of the sword will die by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or do you think that I cannot call on my Father, and that he would send me more than twelve legions of angels right now?
speaker: Narrator

text: How then would the scriptures that say it must happen this way be fulfilled?”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that moment Jesus said to the crowd, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me like you would an outlaw? Day after day I sat teaching in the temple courts, yet you did not arrest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this has happened so that the scriptures of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples left him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the ones who had arrested Jesus led him to Caiaphas, the high priest, in whose house the experts in the law and the elders had gathered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter was following him from a distance, all the way to the high priest’s courtyard. After going in, he sat with the guards to see the outcome.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were trying to find false testimony against Jesus so that they could put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not find anything, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward
speaker: Narrator

text: and declared, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer? What is this that they are testifying against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus was silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God, tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself. But I tell you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest tore his clothes and declared, “He has blasphemed! Why do we still need witnesses? Now you have heard the blasphemy!
speaker: Narrator

text: What is your verdict?” They answered, “He is guilty and deserves death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they spat in his face and struck him with their fists. And some slapped him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Prophesy for us, you Christ! Who hit you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A slave girl came to him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it in front of them all: “I don’t know what you’re talking about!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he went out to the gateway, another slave girl saw him and said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus the Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He denied it again with an oath, “I do not know the man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After a little while, those standing there came up to Peter and said, “You really are one of them too—even your accent gives you away!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that he began to curse, and he swore with an oath, “I do not know the man!” At that moment a rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people plotted against Jesus to execute him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tied him up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate the governor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus had been condemned, he regretted what he had done and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood!” But they said, “What is that to us? You take care of it yourself!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judas threw the silver coins into the temple and left. Then he went out and hanged himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests took the silver and said, “It is not lawful to put this into the temple treasury, since it is blood money.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After consulting together they bought the Potter’s Field with it, as a burial place for foreigners.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason that field has been called the “Field of Blood” to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty silver coins, the price of the one whose price had been set by the people of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus said, “You say so.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he did not respond.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many charges they are bringing against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not answer even one accusation, so that the governor was quite amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the feast the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd, whomever they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time they had in custody a notorious prisoner named Jesus Barabbas.
speaker: Narrator

text: So after they had assembled, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release for you, Jesus Barabbas or Jesus who is called the Christ?”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For he knew that they had handed him over because of envy.)
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent a message to him: “Have nothing to do with that innocent man; I have suffered greatly as a result of a dream about him today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The governor asked them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate said to them, “Then what should I do with Jesus who is called the Christ?” They all said, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked, “Why? What wrong has he done?” But they shouted more insistently, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate saw that he could do nothing, but that instead a riot was starting, he took some water, washed his hands before the crowd and said, “I am innocent of this man’s blood. You take care of it yourselves!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In reply all the people said, “Let his blood be on us and on our children!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he released Barabbas for them. But after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the governor’s residence and gathered the whole cohort around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe around him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after braiding a crown of thorns, they put it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand, and kneeling down before him, they mocked him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They spat on him and took the staff and struck him repeatedly on the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had mocked him, they stripped him of the robe and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were going out, they found a man from Cyrene named Simon, whom they forced to carry his cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means “Place of the Skull”)
speaker: Narrator

text: and offered Jesus wine mixed with gall to drink. But after tasting it, he would not drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothes by throwing dice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sat down and kept guard over him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above his head they put the charge against him, which read: “This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then two outlaws were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who passed by defamed him, shaking their heads
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “You who can destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are God’s Son, come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way even the chief priests—together with the experts in the law and elders—were mocking him:
speaker: Narrator

text: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself! He is the king of Israel! If he comes down now from the cross, we will believe in him!
speaker: Narrator

text: He trusts in God—let God, if he wants to, deliver him now because he said, ‘I am God’s Son’!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The robbers who were crucified with him also spoke abusively to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now from noon until three, darkness came over all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: At about three o’clock Jesus shouted with a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” that is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When some of the bystanders heard it, they said, “This man is calling for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge, filled it with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the rest said, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah will come to save him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried out again with a loud voice and gave up his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then the temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom. The earth shook and the rocks were split apart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And tombs were opened, and the bodies of many saints who had died were raised.
speaker: Narrator

text: (They came out of the tombs after his resurrection and went into the holy city and appeared to many people.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and what took place, they were extremely terrified and said, “Truly this one was God’s Son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee and given him support were also there, watching from a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who was also a disciple of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut in the rock. Then he rolled a great stone across the entrance of the tomb and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there, opposite the tomb.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day (which is after the day of preparation) the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled before Pilate
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Sir, we remember that while that deceiver was still alive he said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So give orders to secure the tomb until the third day. Otherwise his disciples may come and steal his body and say to the people, ‘He has been raised from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate said to them, “Take a guard of soldiers. Go and make it as secure as you can.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went with the soldiers of the guard and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly there was a severe earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descending from heaven came and rolled away the stone and sat on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: The guards were shaken and became like dead men because they were so afraid of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid; I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not here, for he has been raised, just as he said. Come and see the place where he was lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has been raised from the dead. He is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see him there.’ Listen, I have told you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they left the tomb quickly, with fear and great joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus met them, saying, “Greetings!” They came to him, held on to his feet and worshiped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee. They will see me there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were going, some of the guard went into the city and told the chief priests everything that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had assembled with the elders and formed a plan, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
speaker: Narrator

text: telling them, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came at night and stole his body while we were asleep.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If this matter is heard before the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story is told among the Jews to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the eleven disciples went to Galilee to the mountain Jesus had designated.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw him, they worshiped him, but some doubted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came up and said to them, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And remember, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”
speaker: Narrator
